sentences.en: 'It's just delaying the inevitable,' he said.
sentences.cn: “那仅仅会延迟不可避免之事的发生，”他说。

sentences.en: "It's just delaying the inevitable," he said.
sentences.cn: “那仅仅会延迟不可避免之事的发生，”他说。

sentences.en: A further escalation of the crisis now seems inevitable.
sentences.cn: 危机的进一步升级现在看来已不可避免。

sentences.en: Diplomats believe that bureaucratic delays are inevitable.
sentences.cn: 外交官们认为繁文缛节造成的延迟是在所难免的。

sentences.en: He bowed to the inevitable and announced that he was willing to resume diplomatic relations.
sentences.cn: 迫于形势他只好宣称愿意恢复外交关系。

sentences.en: He resigns himself to the inevitable, and goes out.
sentences.cn: 他带着一副事已至此 、 无可奈何的样子走了出去.

sentences.en: His election made conflict with Francis I virtually inevitable.
sentences.cn: 皇帝的选举使他与弗兰西斯一世的冲突几乎不可避免.

sentences.en: If the case succeeds, it is inevitable that other trials will follow.
sentences.cn: 如果该案胜诉，其他审判必然随之而来。

sentences.en: In earlier ages, class distinctions had been not only inevitable but desirable.
sentences.cn: 在以前的各个时代里, 阶级区分不仅不可避免,而且是适宜的.

sentences.en: It seems almost inevitable that North African economies will still be primarily oriented towards Europe.
sentences.cn: 看来北非经济体几乎注定还将以欧洲为主导。

sentences.en: It was an inevitable consequence of the decision.
sentences.cn: 那是这个决定的必然后果。

sentences.en: Its fall and the victory of the proletariat are equally inevitable.
sentences.cn: 资产阶级的灭亡和无产阶级的胜利是同样不可避免的.
有时改变决定可能是不可避免的。

sentences.en: The occurance of failure is inevitable and independent of man's will.
sentences.cn: 失败的发生是不可避免的,并且是不以人的意志为转移的.

sentences.en: There were inevitable bouts of homesickness.
sentences.cn: 难免会涌起一阵阵的思乡情绪。

sentences.en: They'rs not too worrid, and they know it is inevitable.
sentences.cn: 他们并不是太发愁, 知道这是大势所趋.

trans.tran_cn: 不可避免的，必然发生的，必然(发生)的
trans.tran_en: certain to happen and impossible to avoid
